review: Tremendous bargain for what it offers but it's not really a "cord cutting" devices as services like the excellent ESPN app require a subscription through your cable company. However, be aware that your cable provider (thanks for nothing, Charter!) may limit streaming of premium channels you already own.
author: Rob Oliver

review: I am a Amazon Prime member and expected more free "network TV" network options.  I just installed it, pretty easy to install and provides movies and apps.  However, you have to download the apps as you go.  Moreover, seems like a lot of upselling to pay for features.  I am giving it a try and we'll see as we go along as to the value it brings.
author: Jim G.

review: I absolutely LOVE it!! I highly recommend it!

review: Easy to install, apps easy to select. In 5 minutes was watching progams.The video and music quality is better than Dish Network. For the price it's an amazing deal.
author: Roy Nichols

review: The entire family has thoroughly enjoyed the Amazon Fire Stick.  Even with "SMART" televisions with embedded apps, we have found the Fire Stick to be super fast and containing everything that we enjoy.  It's even better when we travel.  No matter where we go, no more hassling with cell phone mirroring or other methods with a computer.  The Fire Stick is quick and easy.
author: G. Bridgers "WxWise"

review: I had no problem at all with my Amazon Fire TV stick, I would truly recommend if your changing from cable to the Sling T.V.
